did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Amelia County (Va.) Public Buildings and Grounds, Plan of the new courthouse, 1767

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Amelia County (Va.) Public Buildings and Grounds, Plan of the new courthouse, 1767. Local government records collection, Amelia County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court papers from Amelia County under the accession number 43189.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Amelia County was formed in 1734 from Brunswick and Prince George counties.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Amelia County (Va.) Public Buildings and Grounds, Plan of the new courthouse, 1767, is a one page drawing and specifications for the first Amelia County courthouse.

Also included is a short report from 1992 detailing conservation work done on the plan by the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts. The report includes four slides of the plan before and after conservation was done.
